$interpreted: : Kingdom of the Sun, the most powerful country on Continent Vendacti, has a long history of prosperity spanning over 200 years.
: Now, however, due to the political conflict between Regent Theodore and Princess Angelia,
: the kingdom has been divided in two and a civil war has begun...
: Angelia's army, although outnumbered, was able to withstand Theodore's attack, utilizing terrain advantage,
: the assistance from the Bears and the support of some nobles.
: Meanwhile, the faraway Desert Kingdom was showing signs of restlessness. Whether it's craving the divided Kingdom of the Sun remains unknown.
: But Theodore, fearing an unpleasant surprise, had no choice but to temporarily withdraw from his assault against the Sunshine Infantry.
: This gave Angelia some time to catch her breath.
: As the Kingdom became unstable, rumors spread like wildfire.
: From Theodore not being King William's actual brother to Theodore's apparent illegitimate son being abandoned in the suburbs...

: But one omen garnered the most attention:
"The wings of the Half-Blood, shall swipe away the imposter blocking the Sun".
: Repeated in whispers among the nobles, the "imposter" almost certainly referring to Theodore, but what of "wings of the Half-Blood"?
: The nobles had countless discussions about this in private, but no one dared to mention this in front of Theodore...
: In order to recruit more soldiers to fight against Angelia, Theodore not only issued mandatory conscription orders to nobles around the kingdom,
: but he also offered lucrative rewards to those who enlisted. The rewards attracted students of Rune Academy, who have longed for a stage
: to showcase their power. Many students dropped out of the Academy to join Theodore's side.
: Even though Rune Academy's stance on the conflict is completely neutral, it couldn't stop the students from doing what they desire...
: Seeing that the deficit with Theodore's army is getting larger and larger, Angelia and co. seeks to counter that trend. Taking Dylan's suggestion,
: they pay a visit to a small village, seeking a particular person that could help Sunshine Infantry turn the tides of this war...

Model.Text: Kingdom of the Sun, the most powerful country on Continent Vendacti, has a long history of prosperity spanning over 200 years.
Now, however, due to the political conflict between Regent Theodore and Princess Angelia,
the kingdom has been divided in two and a civil war has begun...
Angelia's army, although outnumbered, was able to withstand Theodore's attack, utilizing terrain advantage,
the assistance from the Bears and the support of some nobles.
Meanwhile, the faraway Desert Kingdom was showing signs of restlessness. Whether it's craving the divided Kingdom of the Sun remains unknown.
But Theodore, fearing an unpleasant surprise, had no choice but to temporarily withdraw from his assault against the Sunshine Infantry.
This gave Angelia some time to catch her breath.
As the Kingdom became unstable, rumors spread like wildfire.
From Theodore not being King William's actual brother to Theodore's apparent illegitimate son being abandoned in the suburbs...

But one omen garnered the most attention:
"The wings of the Half-Blood, shall swipe away the imposter blocking the Sun".
Repeated in whispers among the nobles, the "imposter" almost certainly referring to Theodore, but what of "wings of the Half-Blood"?
The nobles had countless discussions about this in private, but no one dared to mention this in front of Theodore...
In order to recruit more soldiers to fight against Angelia, Theodore not only issued mandatory conscription orders to nobles around the kingdom,
but he also offered lucrative rewards to those who enlisted. The rewards attracted students of Rune Academy, who have longed for a stage
to showcase their power. Many students dropped out of the Academy to join Theodore's side.
Even though Rune Academy's stance on the conflict is completely neutral, it couldn't stop the students from doing what they desire...
Seeing that the deficit with Theodore's army is getting larger and larger, Angelia and co. seeks to counter that trend. Taking Dylan's suggestion,
they pay a visit to a small village, seeking a particular person that could help Sunshine Infantry turn the tides of this war...
